key.name: profile-list
key.summary: List of profiles
key.description: List of profiles known to mate-terminal. The list contains strings naming subdirectories relative to /org/mate/terminal/profiles.

key.name: default-profile
key.summary: Profile to use for new terminals
key.description: Profile to be used when opening a new window or tab. Must be in profile_list.

key.name: use-mnemonics
key.summary: Whether the menubar has access keys
key.description: Whether to have Alt+letter access keys for the menubar. They may interfere with some applications run inside the terminal so it's possible to turn them off.

key.name: use-menu-accelerators
key.summary: Whether the standard GTK shortcut for menubar access is enabled
key.description: Normally you can access the menubar with F10. This can also be customized via gtkrc (gtk-menu-bar-accel = "whatever"). This option allows the standard menubar accelerator to be disabled.

key.name: active-encodings
key.summary: List of available encodings
key.description: A subset of possible encodings are presented in the Encoding submenu. This is a list of encodings to appear there. The special encoding name "current" means to display the encoding of the current locale.

key.name: confirm-window-close
key.summary: Whether to ask for confirmation when closing terminal windows
key.description: Whether to ask for confirmation when closing a terminal window which has more than one open tab.

key.name: visible-name
key.summary: Human-readable name of the profile
key.description: Human-readable name of the profile.

key.name: default-show-menubar
key.summary: Whether to show menubar in new windows/tabs
key.description: True if the menubar should be shown in new windows, for windows/tabs with this profile.

key.name: foreground-color
key.summary: Default color of text in the terminal
key.description: Default color of text in the terminal, as a color specification (can be HTML-style hex digits, or a color name such as "red").

key.name: background-color
key.summary: Default color of terminal background
key.description: Default color of terminal background, as a color specification (can be HTML-style hex digits, or a color name such as "red").

key.name: bold-color
key.summary: Default color of bold text in the terminal
key.description: Default color of bold text in the terminal, as a color specification (can be HTML-style hex digits, or a color name such as "red"). This is ignored if bold_color_same_as_fg is true.

key.name: bold-color-same-as-fg
key.summary: Whether bold text should use the same color as normal text
key.description: If true, boldface text will be rendered using the same color as normal text.

key.name: title-mode
key.summary: What to do with dynamic title
key.description: If the application in the terminal sets the title (most typically people have their shell set up to do this), the dynamically-set title can erase the configured title, go before it, go after it, or replace it. The possible values are "replace", "before", "after", and "ignore".

key.name: title
key.summary: Title for terminal
key.description: Title to display for the terminal window or tab. This title may be replaced by or combined with the title set by the application inside the terminal, depending on the title_mode setting.

key.name: allow-bold
key.summary: Whether to allow bold text
key.description: If true, allow applications in the terminal to make text boldface.

key.name: silent-bell
key.summary: Whether to silence terminal bell
key.description: If true, don't make a noise when applications send the escape sequence for the terminal bell.

key.name: word-chars
key.summary: Characters that are considered "part of a word"
key.description: When selecting text by word, sequences of these characters are considered single words. Ranges can be given as "A-Z". Literal hyphen (not expressing a range) should be the first character given.

key.name: use-custom-default-size
key.summary: Whether to use custom terminal size for new windows
key.description: If true, newly created terminal windows will have custom size specified by default_size_columns and default_size_rows.

key.name: default-size-columns
key.summary: Default number of columns
key.description: Number of columns in newly created terminal windows. Has no effect if use_custom_default_size is not enabled.

key.name: default-size-rows
key.summary: Default number of rows
key.description: Number of rows in newly created terminal windows. Has no effect if use_custom_default_size is not enabled.

key.name: scrollbar-position
key.summary: Position of the scrollbar
key.description: Where to put the terminal scrollbar. Possibilities are "left", "right", and "hidden".

key.name: scrollback-lines
key.summary: Number of lines to keep in scrollback
key.description: Number of scrollback lines to keep around. You can scroll back in the terminal by this number of lines; lines that don't fit in the scrollback are discarded. If scrollback_unlimited is true, this value is ignored.

key.name: scrollback-unlimited
key.summary: Whether an unlimited number of lines should be kept in scrollback
key.description: If true, scrollback lines will never be discarded. The scrollback history is stored on disk temporarily, so this may cause the system to run out of disk space if there is a lot of output to the terminal.

key.name: scroll-on-keystroke
key.summary: Whether to scroll to the bottom when a key is pressed
key.description: If true, pressing a key jumps the scrollbar to the bottom.

key.name: scroll-on-output
key.summary: Whether to scroll to the bottom when there's new output
key.description: If true, whenever there's new output the terminal will scroll to the bottom.

key.name: exit-action
key.summary: What to do with the terminal when the child command exits
key.description: Possible values are "close" to close the terminal, and "restart" to restart the command.

key.name: login-shell
key.summary: Whether to launch the command in the terminal as a login shell
key.description: If true, the command inside the terminal will be launched as a login shell. (argv[0] will have a hyphen in front of it.)

key.name: update-records
key.summary: Whether to update login records when launching terminal command
key.description: If true, the system login records utmp and wtmp will be updated when the command inside the terminal is launched.

key.name: use-custom-command
key.summary: Whether to run a custom command instead of the shell
key.description: If true, the value of the custom_command setting will be used in place of running a shell.

key.name: cursor-blink-mode
key.summary: Whether to blink the cursor
key.description: The possible values are "system" to use the global cursor blinking settings, or "on" or "off" to set the mode explicitly.

key.name: cursor-shape
key.summary: The cursor appearance
key.description: The possible values are "block" to use a block cursor, "ibeam" to use a vertical line cursor, or "underline" to use an underline cursor.

key.name: custom-command
key.summary: Custom command to use instead of the shell
key.description: Run this command in place of the shell, if use_custom_command is true.

key.name: icon
key.summary: Icon for terminal window
key.description: Icon to use for tabs/windows containing this profile.

key.name: palette
key.summary: Palette for terminal applications
key.description: Terminals have a 16-color palette that applications inside the terminal can use. This is that palette, in the form of a colon-separated list of color names. Color names should be in hex format e.g. "#FF00FF"

key.name: font
key.summary: Font
key.description: An Pango font name. Examples are "Sans 12" or "Monospace Bold 14".

key.name: background-type
key.summary: Background type
key.description: Type of terminal background. May be "solid" for a solid color, "image" for an image, or "transparent" for either real transparency if a compositing window manager is running, or pseudo-transparency otherwise.

key.name: background-image
key.summary: Background image
key.description: Filename of a background image.

key.name: scroll-background
key.summary: Whether to scroll background image
key.description: If true, scroll the background image with the foreground text; if false, keep the image in a fixed position and scroll the text above it.

key.name: background-darkness
key.summary: How much to darken the background image
key.description: A value between 0.0 and 1.0 indicating how much to darken the background image. 0.0 means no darkness, 1.0 means fully dark. In the current implementation, there are only two levels of darkness possible, so the setting behaves as a boolean, where 0.0 disables the darkening effect.

key.name: backspace-binding
key.summary: Effect of the Backspace key
key.description: Sets what code the backspace key generates. Possible values are "ascii-del" for the ASCII DEL character, "control-h" for Control-H (AKA the ASCII BS character), "escape-sequence" for the escape sequence typically bound to backspace or delete. "ascii-del" is normally considered the correct setting for the Backspace key.

key.name: delete-binding
key.summary: Effect of the Delete key
key.description: Sets what code the delete key generates. Possible values are "ascii-del" for the ASCII DEL character, "control-h" for Control-H (AKA the ASCII BS character), "escape-sequence" for the escape sequence typically bound to backspace or delete. "escape-sequence" is normally considered the correct setting for the Delete key.

key.name: use-theme-colors
key.summary: Whether to use the colors from the theme for the terminal widget
key.description: If true, the theme color scheme used for text entry boxes will be used for the terminal, instead of colors provided by the user.

key.name: use-system-font
key.summary: Whether to use the system font
key.description: If true, the terminal will use the desktop-global standard font if it's monospace (and the most similar font it can come up with otherwise).

key.name: use-skey
key.summary: Highlight S/Key challenges
key.description: Popup a dialog when an S/Key challenge response query is detected and clicked on. Typing a password into the dialog will send it to the terminal.

key.name: new-tab
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to open a new tab
key.description: Keyboard shortcut key for opening a new tab. Expressed as a string in the same format used for GTK+ resource files. If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keyboard shortcut for this action.

key.name: new-window
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to open a new window
key.description: Keyboard shortcut key for opening a new window. Expressed as a string in the same format used for GTK+ resource files. If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keyboard shortcut for this action.

key.name: new-profile
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to create a new profile
key.description: Keyboard shortcut key for bringing up the dialog for profile creation. Expressed as a string in the same format used for GTK+ resource files. If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keyboard shortcut for this action.

key.name: save-contents
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to save the current tab contents to file
key.description: Keyboard shortcut key to save the current tab contents to a file. Expressed as a string in the same format used for GTK+ resource files. If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keyboard shortcut for this action.

key.name: close-tab
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to close a tab
key.description: Keyboard shortcut key for closing a tab. Expressed as a string in the same format used for GTK+ resource files. If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keyboard shortcut for this action.

key.name: close-window
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to close a window
key.description: Keyboard shortcut key for closing a window. Expressed as a string in the same format used for GTK+ resource files. If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keyboard shortcut for this action.

key.name: copy
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to copy text
key.description: Keyboard shortcut key for copying selected text to the clipboard. Expressed as a string in the same format used for GTK+ resource files. If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keyboard shortcut for this action.

key.name: paste
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to paste text
key.description: Keyboard shortcut key for pasting the contents of the clipboard into the terminal. Expressed as a string in the same format used for GTK+ resource files. If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keyboard shortcut for this action.

key.name: full-screen
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to toggle full screen mode
key.description: Keyboard shortcut key for toggling full screen mode. Expressed as a string in the same format used for GTK+ resource files. If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keyboard shortcut for this action.

key.name: toggle-menubar
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to toggle the visibility of the menubar
key.description: Keyboard shortcut key to toggle the visibility of the menubar. Expressed as a string in the same format used for GTK+ resource files. If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keyboard shortcut for this action.

key.name: set-terminal-title
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to set the terminal title
key.description: Keyboard shortcut key to set the terminal title. Expressed as a string in the same format used for GTK+ resource files. If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keyboard shortcut for this action.

key.name: reset
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to reset the terminal
key.description: Keyboard shortcut key to reset the terminal. Expressed as a string in the same format used for GTK+ resource files. If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keyboard shortcut for this action.

key.name: reset-and-clear
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to reset and clear the terminal
key.description: Keyboard shortcut key to reset and clear the terminal. Expressed as a string in the same format used for GTK+ resource files. If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keyboard shortcut for this action.

key.name: prev-tab
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to switch to the previous tab
key.description: Keyboard shortcut key to switch to the previous tab. Expressed as a string in the same format used for GTK+ resource files. If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keyboard shortcut for this action.

key.name: next-tab
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to switch to the next tab
key.description: Keyboard shortcut key to switch to the next tab. Expressed as a string in the same format used for GTK+ resource files. If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keyboard shortcut for this action.

key.name: move-tab-left
key.summary: Accelerator to move the current tab to the left.
key.description: Accelerator key to move the current tab to the left. Expressed as a string in the same format used for GTK+ resource files. If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keybinding for this action.

key.name: move-tab-right
key.summary: Accelerator to move the current tab to the right.
key.description: Accelerator key to move the current tab to the right. Expressed as a string in the same format used for GTK+ resource files. If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keybinding for this action.

key.name: detach-tab
key.summary: Accelerator to detach current tab.
key.description: Accelerator key to detach current tab. Expressed as a string in the same format used for GTK+ resource files. If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keybinding for this action.

key.name: switch-to-tab-1
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to switch to tab 1
key.description: Keyboard shortcut key for switch to tab 1. Expressed as a string in the same format used for GTK+ resource files. If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keyboard shortcut for this action.

key.name: switch-to-tab-2
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to switch to tab 2
key.description: Keyboard shortcut key for switch to tab 2. Expressed as a string in the same format used for GTK+ resource files. If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keyboard shortcut for this action.

key.name: switch-to-tab-3
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to switch to tab 3
key.description: Keyboard shortcut key for switch to tab 3. Expressed as a string in the same format used for GTK+ resource files. If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keyboard shortcut for this action.

key.name: switch-to-tab-4
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to switch to tab 4
key.description: Keyboard shortcut key for switch to tab 4. Expressed as a string in the same format used for GTK+ resource files. If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keyboard shortcut for this action.

key.name: switch-to-tab-5
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to switch to tab 5
key.description: Keyboard shortcut key for switch to tab 5. Expressed as a string in the same format used for GTK+ resource files. If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keyboard shortcut for this action.

key.name: switch-to-tab-6
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to switch to tab 6
key.description: Keyboard shortcut key for switch to tab 6. Expressed as a string in the same format used for GTK+ resource files. If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keyboard shortcut for this action.

key.name: switch-to-tab-7
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to switch to tab 7
key.description: Keyboard shortcut key for switch to tab 7. Expressed as a string in the same format used for GTK+ resource files. If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keyboard shortcut for this action.

key.name: switch-to-tab-8
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to switch to tab 8
key.description: Keyboard shortcut key for switch to tab 8. Expressed as a string in the same format used for GTK+ resource files. If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keyboard shortcut for this action.

key.name: switch-to-tab-9
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to switch to tab 9
key.description: Keyboard shortcut key for switch to tab 9. Expressed as a string in the same format used for GTK+ resource files. If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keyboard shortcut for this action.

key.name: switch-to-tab-10
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to switch to tab 10
key.description: Keyboard shortcut key for switch to tab 10. Expressed as a string in the same format used for GTK+ resource files. If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keyboard shortcut for this action.

key.name: switch-to-tab-11
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to switch to tab 11
key.description: Keyboard shortcut key for switch to tab 11. Expressed as a string in the same format used for GTK+ resource files. If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keyboard shortcut for this action.

key.name: switch-to-tab-12
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to switch to tab 12
key.description: Keyboard shortcut key for switch to tab 12. Expressed as a string in the same format used for GTK+ resource files. If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keyboard shortcut for this action.

key.name: help
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to launch help
key.description: Keyboard shortcut key for launching help. Expressed as a string in the same format used for GTK+ resource files. If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keyboard shortcut for this action.

key.name: zoom-in
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to make font larger
key.description: Keyboard shortcut key for making font larger. Expressed as a string in the same format used for GTK+ resource files. If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keyboard shortcut for this action.

key.name: zoom-out
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to make font smaller
key.description: Keyboard shortcut key for making font smaller. Expressed as a string in the same format used for GTK+ resource files. If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keyboard shortcut for this action.

key.name: zoom-normal
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to make font normal-size
key.description: Keyboard shortcut key for making font the normal size. Expressed as a string in the same format used for GTK+ resource files. If you set the option to the special string "disabled", then there will be no keyboard shortcut for this action.
